dashboard.title: Dashboard

errors.api_gen: API key not generated: you should not even have access to this page. How did you pull that one off?
errors.api_miss: API key not sent: dms-gui did not sent the API KEY to the Mailserver API, how did you pull that one off?
errors.api_match: API key mismatch: you must update your Mailserver compose with the API KEY you can see in Settings and restart it.
errors.api_unset: API key unset: you must add the API KEY you can see in Settings in your Mailserver compose and restart it.
errors.api_error: Unknown API error: something badwrong happened with the python API we injected in your Mailserver.
errors.port_closed: API port is closed/filtered, or API is not running yet
errors.port_timout: API port timeout: increase timeout and retry
errors.missing: containerName not found or DNS error
errors.unknown: Unknown error: cannot tell what the proble is, open the browser debugger and look for clues.

dashboard.error: Unable to load dashboard data. Please check server connection.

logins.isFirstRun:
WELCOME TO dms-gui!
This is the first time you access this page.
1️⃣ Default login is admin and password=changeme
2️⃣ Go to Logins and change the password.
3️⃣ Finally, create a DMS container and API key in Settings.
logins.isDEMO:
WELCOME TO dms-gui!
This is a demo server, rebooted every hour.
1️⃣ Default login is admin and password=changeme
2️⃣ You can create another DMS container and API key in Settings, and play with current users.

logins.roles2pick: Pick mailboxes this login can manage
logins.unlinkAccount: Unlink {{username}} from its mailbox: password handled by dms-gui
logins.usernameHelp: Login username to login on this portal
logins.welcomeDEMO: Welcome on the dms-gui DEMO server
logins.title: Logins Page

settings.aboutDescription: Docker-Mailserver GUI is a graphical interface for managing your Docker-Mailserver. The application allows easy management of email accounts, aliases, and monitoring server status.
settings.aboutText: Docker-Mailserver GUI is a graphical interface for managing your Docker-Mailserver. The application allows easy management of email accounts, aliases, and monitoring server status.
settings.dnsProviderHelp: Choose your DNS provider; not seeing yours? Submit a PR!
settings.emailHelp: admin email will be used in the future to send alerts and stuff
settings.cannotSaveSettings: Unable to save settings. Please try again.
settings.cannotSaveLogins: Unable to save logins. Please try again.
settings.DMSHelp: Select the current mailserver container to handle
settings.DMS_API_KEYinit:
DMS_API_KEY: {{DMS_API_KEY}}

Now that the API key is created, you need to do 4 things with your DMS compose:
1️⃣ Expose the API port: 
expose: 8888
2️⃣ Add these environment variables: 
- DMS_API_KEY: {{DMS_API_KEY}}
- DMS_API_PORT: {{DMS_API_PORT}}
3️⃣ Add this volume file:
- ./config/dms-gui/rest-api.conf:/etc/supervisor/conf.d/rest-api.conf:ro
4️⃣ Finally, restart your {{containerName}} container (and retest API from here).

The API log will be appended here: 
[{{containerName}} path]/logs/supervisor/rest-api.log
settings.DMS_API_KEYinitHelp: Show the steps to connect with DMS
settings.DMS_API_KEYmatch:
DMS_API_KEY: {{DMS_API_KEY}}

REST API is installed! However, the API key has changed, you need to do 2 things with your DMS compose:
1️⃣ Update the API KEY variable: 
- DMS_API_KEY: {{DMS_API_KEY}}
2️⃣ restart your {{containerName}} container (and retest API from here).

The API log will be appended here: 
[{{containerName}} path]/logs/supervisor/rest-api.log
settings.DMS_API_KEYRequired: DMS_API_KEY is required and must be set in DMS compose
settings.DMS_API_KEYHelp: DMS_API_KEY is used to authenticate with DMS container command API
settings.DMS_API_KEYSaved:
DMS_API_KEY: {{DMS_API_KEY}}

REST API is installed and running! All good!
settings.DMS_API_PORTHelp: DMS_API_PORT must also be exposed in DMS compose
settings.DMS_API_injectFailedHelp: Look at the actual injection error; Most likely you have already mounted rest-api.conf in READ ONLY within your Mailserver compose, restart the Mailserver container without it and retry.
settings.timeoutHelp: timeout for execution on the container
settings.containerNameHelp: Name of the Docker container running Docker-Mailserver.
settings.containerNameRequired: Name of Docker-Mailserver container is required.
settings.protocolHelp: HTTP is all you need, unless using K8
settings.running: {{containerName}} is alive, port {{DMS_API_PORT}} is open and API responded successfully!
settings.saveAdvice: Go ahead and save the settings, then follow the directions below.
settings.setupPathHelp: Full path to the internal DMS setup script.
settings.setupPathRequired: Full path to the internal DMS setup script is required.
